sourceDesc.p: Generated test file to exercise all supported TEI elements

div.head: Preface
div.p: This is a test document designed to exercise every element supported by the TEI converter. It includes examples of all structural elements, inline formatting, poetry, tables, figures, and special features.
The goal is to verify that each element renders correctly in both HTML and plain text output.

div.head: Chapter 1: Basic Text Elements
div.p: This is a simple paragraph with no special formatting. It should appear as normal body text.
This paragraph contains italic text, bold text, and underlined text to test inline formatting.
Here is some Small Caps Text to demonstrate that feature.
Here is some emphasized text using the semantic emphasis element instead of hi.
This paragraph includes a phrase en français to test foreign language markup.
We can mention the title of a book like Pride and Prejudice within the text.

div.head: Chapter 2: Quotations
div.p: This paragraph contains an inline quotation: To be or not to be said Hamlet.
div.quote: This is a block quotation that stands alone, not within a paragraph. It should be rendered as a blockquote element in HTML and indented in plain text.
div.p: Block quotes are useful for longer excerpts from other works or important passages that need to stand out from the main text.

div.head: Chapter 6: Breaks and Milestones
div.p: This chapter demonstrates various types of breaks and section markers.
First paragraph before a thought break.
Second paragraph after a star break. The milestone element creates a visual separator.
Third paragraph after a space break. This creates vertical spacing without decorative elements.

Line breaks can appear within paragraphs.
This text appears after a line break but within the same paragraph element.
This paragraph appears after a page break marker (page 42). Page breaks are useful for maintaining references to original pagination.
